feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:08AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ....Elevated Surf Through Tonight... Elevated surf will continue through tonight. North winds of 20 to 25 mph will continue today and diminish tonight. This will cause waves to wash near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:08AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Through Saturday... Elevated surf will continue into Saturday. Winds will become northwesterly late today and increase to 20 to 30 mph tonight into Saturday. This will cause waves to wash near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:08AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds Tonight Through Saturday... West winds will increase after Midnight night to around 30 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph tonight through Saturday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:06AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Today into Saturday... Elevated surf will develop today and continue into Saturday. Northwest winds of 20 to 30 mph are expected today into Saturday causing waves to wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued August 05 at 3:53AM AKDT until August 07 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Total snow accumulations of 8 inches are possible above 3000 feet, with 2 to 4 inches from 2000 to 3000 feet. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range above 2000 feet.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 05 at 3:51AM AKDT until August 07 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM SATURDAY TO 6 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * LOCATION...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * TIMING...From 2 AM Saturday until 6 AM Sunday. * IMPACTS...Beach erosion will occur. Belongings left on the beach may wash away. Logs and debris will wash up on to the beach.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast
